title: This Is the Fastest, Easiest Way to Make Whipped Cream
description:
Homemade whipped cream is one of my favorite dessert toppings, but it takes time to make, even in a stand mixer. Of course, it takes even longer if you do it manually. Besides eating up your precious time, whisking by hand requires a lot of energy, and it’s truly awful for big batches. It turns out there’s actually a…

description:
If you’re in the market for a new laptop, one of Dell’s latest deals might be worth checking out. The Dell Vostro 7620 laptop is on clearance for $749—that’s $650 off the original retail price of $1,399.

title: Yes, It's OK to Run Every Day
description:
Rest days are important, but how much do they matter for running? Beginner programs like a Couch to 5K often start you off with three days of running per week, advising you to take it easy on the others. But once you’ve gotten past that beginner stage, you might start wondering if it’s okay to run more days a…

title: Make a Vibrant Syrup Using the Liquid From a Can of Fruit
description:
I come from the land of congealed salads, a land of Cool Whip and canned fruit. While the original recipe for ambrosia called for fresh citrus and shaved coconut, its progeny lean heavily on the canned stuff, so I’ve always had a soft spot for peaches, pineapple, and cherries that come swimming in syrup.

title: How to Get Back on Track After an Expensive Vacation
description:
Whatever the weather forecast says, summer is winding down, as is peak summer travel. When you return from vacation, you hope to bring a few things back to your real life: some souvenirs, a healthy tan, maybe even a more relaxed version of yourself. What you don’t want to bring back: post-vacation debt.

title: The Best Turkey Dry Brine Recipe Is a Simple Ratio
description:
Turkey needs salt. It is a something you cannot skip. Salt doesn’t just make the meat taste salty, it makes the meat taste good, while breaking down the tougher parts of the bird for a more tender bite. Dry brining—also known as “salting”—is a popular way to add flavor and tenderize the big bird, and for good reason.…

title: Use the 'Jigsaw Method' to Study Complex Topics
description:
Yes, studying alone and in a quiet space is extremely useful most of the time—but there are instances when studying with someone else can be even more beneficial. title: Use 'Close Reading' to Retain Every Detail When You Study
description:
When you’re assigned to read a text, you’re supposed to take away some big-picture ideas. To get to that broad understanding, though, you should use a method that is all about being detail-oriented. It’s called “close reading,” and it will help you grasp the overall message of whatever you read.
